id: Fifteen Things That Caught My Eye Today (October 30, 2018)							Fifteen Things That Caught My Eye Today (October 30, 2018)
paragraph:
National Review1. Tales of heroes from the Pittsburgh synagogue shooting emerge2.I want to talk for a moment about shomrim, the guards who stay with Jewish bodies until they are buried. I spent three hours on Sunday night in the Pittsburgh morgue, and to me, this spoke powerfully about what's happening here. https://t.co/9OxVn5kIrH— Emma Green (@emmaogreen) October 30, 2018 3.For a lot of cultural Jews who have wondered: Why go to synagogue? Why send my kid to Hebrew school? Even, really, be Jewish? Pittsburgh and this era may fire them up https://t.co/mwXpgjXnbm— Michelle Boorstein (@mboorstein) October 30, 20184. Sohrab Ahmari: Why This Catholic Loves the Jews5. Five nuns kidnapped in southern Nigeria6. Yemen war needs ceasefire, not the world’s silence, says bishop7.pic.twitter.com/suWe9VRLeq— Russell Moore (@drmoore) October 30, 2018  8. Foster families fight Philly discrimination in court next week9. 30 children to welcome new start on National Adoption Day10. Kay Hymowitz celebrates First Man.11. ‘God has become my light’ A Chinese teen’s conversion story12. Love after DementiaNR's afternoon roundup of the day's best commentary & must-read analysis.
